bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to G. Meredith Brill, April 29, 1948

div1.p: Hench sends a photograph of the remains of Camp Lazear Building No. 1, to be included in the publication of Hench's Alpha Omega Alpha lecture by the society.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to G. Meredith Brill, April 29, 1948
div1.opener:
April 29, 1948
Mr. G. Meredith Brill
Managing Editor, The Pharos
Slaterville Springs, New York
My dear Mr. Brill:
div1.p:
I enclose a print of the remains of Walter
Reed's Building Number One, as visited by me, March
1948. Left to Right - Dr. Pedro Nogueira of Havana;
Mr. John Moran of Havana (one of Walter Reed's first
two volunteers); Dr. Philip S. Hench.

You did not mention the possibility of my
getting two or three hundred reprints. I would ap-
preciate information on this. As soon as galley
proof arrives, will return it immediately.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
P. S.: I leave here May 6 for New York, Hotel Waldorf,
will be there May 8 and 9; May 10 - in Charlottesville
Virginia, c/o Dr. A. L. Hench, East Jefferson Street;
May 11 and 12 at the Mayflower Hotel, Washington, D. C.
